page.title: 16MINTERBURN SCHOOL
page.content: The new school at Minterburn was opened on thursday 14th of June 1973 by The Earl of Caledon.A service of dedication was conducted by Rev.S.McMillan and Rev.F.E.Beamish.The school is modern built with grey bricks and stone.There are nine large windows,and glass entrance doors. The school has three classrooms,and a dining- cum- gym room. the teachers at the moment are MRS.1. Boyd, Miss.A. Frazer and Miss.J. Rodgers. They are responsible for 64 children .meals are provided by MRS.R.Mc Dowell and MRS.H.BEll,while MRS.M. Liggett and MR.J. Adams keep the school clean. Apart from all the usual lessons, the school has a gymnastics club and a cycling profecieicy scheme.
